page.title: 18E.Horsley S. Homes for aged
page.content: There are 2 old peoples' homes in the area. Guildford Borough Council pro- vide 26 single self-contained units,6 double & 1 guest, with communal laun- dry, library & a Warden in case of need. A mobile shop calls weekly. Nearby Limegrove is a Surrey County Council home for elderly unable to live alone with single rooms on 3 floors for 48 residents (average age 90) having their own furnishings; 9 lounges with TV & communal diningroom. Every endeavour is made to keep the residents until they die, but there is a shortage of local part-time staff & sometimes in spite of devoted care by all staff, sick residents have to be transferred to a geriatric hospital. Non-residents can spend the day at the home. Extra amenities i.e. minibus for outings, small musical organ, all supplied by "Friends of Limegrove".
